title: Immigration courts fast-track hearings for Somali asylum claims
summary:
Immigration courts fast-track hearings for Somali asylum claimstoggle caption Charles Rex Arbogast/APDozens of asylum cases filed by Somali migrants in immigration courts were suddenly rescheduled and recategorized over the weekend, according to four lawyers interviewed by NPR.
President Trump's rhetoric toward Somali immigrants, as well as his administration's emphasis on deportations, raises concern that the notices represent the first step toward the removal without due process of Somali asylum applicants in the country.
Different types of hearingsThere are generally two kinds of hearings in immigration court: master calendar and individual merits hearings.
Last spring, a memo sent to EOIR staff encouraged immigration judges to deny "legally deficient asylum cases without a hearing."
He characterized Somali immigrants as "garbage" during a Cabinet meeting in early December, adding, "they contribute nothing.

title: Trump’s border tsar warned immigration crackdown would upset public
summary:
Donald Trump’s border tsar warned months ago that the administration’s aggressive and sweeping immigration crackdown risked losing public support.
In a June 16 interview for NBC, published for the first time on Monday, Mr Homan said: “I think the vast majority of the American people think criminal illegal aliens need to leave.
In the face of cross-party and nationwide outcry following the deaths of Renee Good and Alex Pretti, both 37, Mr Trump pledged to “de-escalate”.
He replaced Mr Bovino, the hardline “commander at large” of Border Control who had been leading the immigration operation in the city, with Mr Homan to diffuse the tensions and scale back its most aggressive tactics.
There has been a 2,450 per cent increase in the number of people with no criminal record being held in ICE detention, according to a new report by the American Immigration Council.

title: Number of homeless refugees in England soars, BBC has found
summary:
Once an asylum seeker is given refugee status they have 28 days to move out of government-funded accommodation - usually a house in multiple occupation (HMO) or a hotel - and find their own housing.
At the same time, they must find work or, if necessary, apply for universal credit.

title: Leadership changes in Minnesota follow tensions among agencies over immigration enforcement tactics
summary:
In Congress, the Department of Homeland Security is increasingly under attack by Democrats who want to rein in immigration enforcement.
“In targeted enforcement operations, we go out there.
The Border Patrol does.”The Border Patrol's high-profile raids, including a helicopter landing on the roof of a Chicago apartment building that involved agents rappelling down, rankled ICE officials.
Many were replaced by current or retired officials from CBP, the Border Patrol's parent agency.
Homan's arrival in Minnesota and his emphasis on “targeted enforcement” mark a subtle but unmistakable shift, at least in tone.

title: US moves to deport 5-year-old detained in Minnesota
summary:
By Jasper WardWASHINGTON, Feb 6 (Reuters) - The U.S. Department of Homeland Security said on Friday it is seeking to deport ​a 5-year-old Ecuadorean boy who was detained in Minnesota last month.
"These are regular removal proceedings," ⁠department spokesperson Tricia McLaughlin ‌said, adding, "This is standard procedure and there is nothing retaliatory about enforcing the nation’s immigration laws."
Lawyers for Liam and ‍the Department of Justice did not immediately respond to requests for comments.
The Trump administration defended the move, with the Department of Homeland Security accusing Conejo Arias of being in the U.S. illegally, without providing additional details.
Advertisement AdvertisementProtests have ⁠erupted across Minnesota in opposition to the deployment of immigration agents, who have fatally ‌shot two U.S. citizens in the state.

title: Minneapolis now has daily deportation flights. One man has been documenting them
summary:
Federally chartered deportation flights on ICE Air, as the Department of Homeland Security calls it , aren't new.
But in Trump's second term, their frequency and scope has essentially doubled, according to ICE Flight Monitor, an advocacy initiative that keeps watch.
toggle caption Jaida Grey Eagle"It's just happening in the background," says Benson, motioning to the rest of the airport.
But in recent months, he's started tracking these ICE flights in and out of Minneapolis, counting the people loaded on as they are forced to leave the state.
toggle caption Jaida Grey EagleHe says sometimes the weight of what he's witnessing each day catches up with him.

title: ICE protester speaks out after White House shared fake arrest image
summary:
US civil rights lawyer and activist Nekima Levy Armstrong says she was "disgusted" after the White House posted an image of her arrest which was edited to show her in tears.
She was detained for organising a protest against Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) in a Minnesota church last month.
BBC Verify's Jake Horton spoke to Levy Armstrong about the manipulated image and the backlash she has faced.
Produced by Tom Joyner.
Graphics by Mark Edwards.

title: Judge orders 3 families returned to US after finding agents used 'lies' to deport them
summary:
Judge orders 3 families returned to US after finding agents used 'lies' to deport themIn this Aug. 26, 2011, file photo, the Homeland Security logo is seen shortly before a press conference at FEMA headquarters in Washington, D.C.
In this Aug. 26, 2011, file photo, the Homeland Security logo is seen shortly before a press conference at FEMA headquarters in Washington, D.C.
In this Aug. 26, 2011, file photo, the Homeland Security logo is seen shortly before a press conference at FEMA headquarters in Washington, D.C.
In the eight-page ruling, Judge Sabraw found that the government's removal of the families rendered the protections of the settlement "illusory."
A spokesperson with the Department of Homeland Security did not immediately respond to a request for comment from ABC News.

title: Court records: Chicago immigration raid was about squatters, not Venezuelan gangs
summary:
Court records: Chicago immigration raid was about squatters, not Venezuelan gangstoggle caption Sergio Martínez-Beltrán/NPRNewly revealed arrest records show that a high-profile immigration raid on a South Shore Chicago apartment building last year that became a symbol of President Trump's harsh immigration tactics actually targeted squatters, not Venezuelan gang members.
On multiple occasions, the Trump administration has said the building was frequented by members of Tren de Aragua, a Venezuelan gang.
Sponsor MessageBut arrest records for two of the men show the government's stated reason for the raid was to take out squatters, not gang members.
"They have no legal authority to be addressing purported squatters; that is not within the purview of the federal government."
NPR went inside the building days after the raid and found it dilapidated, with graffiti on walls and doors.

title: ‘Nothing retaliatory’: US seeks deportation of 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos
summary:
Lawyers for the Ecuadorian asylum seeker have speculated the Trump administration is seeking ‘retaliatory’ actions.
The United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has revealed it will continue to seek the deportation of five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father Adrian Conejo Arias, after their recent return to Minnesota.
Photos went viral of Conejo Ramos standing in the snow, dressed in floppy blue bunny ears, with an immigration agent grabbing onto his Spiderman backpack.
The detention of Conejo Ramos and his father had been among the high-profile flashpoints during the crackdown.
Conejo Ramos and his father arrived in the US from Ecuador.

title: South Korea: Official expelled from party for remark on 'importing' foreign women
summary: The Vietnamese Embassy in Seoul had condemned Kim's remarks, saying in a statement on Facebook that his words were "not simply a matter of expression but a matter of values and attitudes towards migrant women and minority groups".
